response.answer_text: They offer a Pay Per View concert and have it beamed throughout the country. Big stars can afford to do that. Regular musicians can give private lessons or put up some YouTube videos to get your name out there. Beyond that, there’s not much you can do except file for unemploment, which could take weeks or months. However, this Coronovirus will not last forever. Well, what I have done, go to your favorite artists website and buy something. A CD, or T Shirt, instruction book, Tote Bag, whatever they got, you want. It will help to support them over this time they can't play live gigs. For the artist, if you are stuck at home, maybe you could sign CDs, and such, just like you would after a gig, when your fans order stuff online. Also, some musicians are giving on line lessons, another way to earn some money, while they can't tour.

Right here in Sydney, Australia as in countless other locations around the world we are seeing thousands who have lost jobs queueing up outside Government offices to sign on for financial assistance. This is an opportunity for accomplished buskers to entertain and lift their spirits. They may not raise much money - no-one recently laid off can afford that much - but it may be an incentive for forward-looking local councils to encourage this activity for the public good.
